pages.text:
A fisherman is an individual whose work is to catch fish in the ponds, canals and even 
in rivers and sell it in the local markets. His main profession is to earn his living by 
selling fish.

A fisherman catches fish everyday. The fishermen promote economic growth and protect our 
environment and natural resources.

Fishing tackle is a general term that refers to the equipment used by fishermen when 
fishing. Almost any equipment used for fishing can be called a fishing tackle. 
Some examples are hooks, lines, sinkers, spears, nets, traps, waders and tackle boxes.

Fishing increases vitamin D. Vitamin D helps regulate the amount of calcium in the 
human body, keeping the bones and teeth healthy. It boosts the immune system.
